name: abdominal-aortic-aneurysm
symptoms: a pulsing sensation in the tummy (like a heartbeat)
tummy pain that does not go away
lower back pain that does not go away
sudden, severe pain in the tummy or lower back

name: abdominal-aortic-aneurysm
symptoms: a pulsing sensation in the tummy (like a heartbeat)
tummy pain that does not go away
lower back pain that does not go away
sudden, severe pain in the tummy or lower back

name: reflux-in-babies
symptoms: bringing up milk or being sick during or shortly after feeding
swallowing or gulping after burping or feeding
not gaining weight as they're not keeping enough food down

name: acne
symptoms: face – this affects almost everyone with acne
back – this affects more than half of people with acne
chest – this affects about 15% of people with acne
blackheads – small black or yellowish bumps that develop on the skin; they're not filled with dirt, but are black because the inner lining of the hair follicle produces colour
whiteheads – have a similar appearance to blackheads, but may be firmer and will not empty when squeezed
papules – small red bumps that may feel tender or sore
pustules – similar to papules, but have a white tip in the centre, caused by a build-up of pus
nodules – large hard lumps that build up beneath the surface of the skin and can be painful
cysts – the most severe type of spot caused by acne; they're large pus-filled lumps that look similar to boils and carry the greatest risk of causing permanent scarring

name: acute-pancreatitis
symptoms: suddenly getting severe pain in the centre of your tummy (abdomen)
a high temperature of 38C or more (fever)

name: addisons-disease
symptoms: loss of appetite and unintentional weight loss

name: alcohol-misuse
symptoms: you feel you should cut down on your drinking
other people have been criticising your drinking
you feel guilty or bad about your drinking
you need a drink first thing in the morning to steady your nerves or get rid of a hangover
they regularly drink more than 14 units of alcohol a week
they're sometimes unable to remember what happened the night before because of their drinking
they fail to do what was expected of them as a result of their drinking (for example, missing an appointment or work because they're drunk or hungover)

name: alcohol-poisoning
symptoms: pale or blue-tinged skin caused by low body temperature (hypothermia)

name: alcohol-related-liver-disease-arld
symptoms: yellowing of the eyes and skin (jaundice)
swelling in the ankles and tummy
vomiting blood or passing blood in your stools

name: allergies
symptoms: worsening of asthma or eczema symptoms

name: vitamin-b12-or-folate-deficiency-anaemia
symptoms: psychological problems, which may include depression and confusion
problems with memory, understanding and judgement

name: anal-cancer
symptoms: itching and pain around the anus
a discharge of mucus from the anus

name: anal-fissure
symptoms: a sharp pain when you poo, often followed by a deep burning pain that may last several hours
bleeding when you poo – most people notice a small amount of bright red blood either in their poo or on the toilet paper

name: anaphylaxis
symptoms: breathing difficulties – such as fast, shallow breathing

name: abdominal-aortic-aneurysm
symptoms: a pulsing sensation in the tummy (like a heartbeat)
tummy pain that does not go away
lower back pain that does not go away
sudden, severe pain in the tummy or lower back

name: angina
symptoms: feels tight, dull or heavy – it may spread to your left arm, neck, jaw or back
is triggered by physical exertion or stress
stops within a few minutes of resting

name: anorexia
symptoms: if you're under 18, your weight and height being lower than expected for your age
if you're an adult, having an unusually low body mass index (BMI)
missing meals, eating very little or avoiding eating any foods you see as fattening
believing you are fat when you are a healthy weight or underweight
taking medicine to reduce your hunger (appetite suppressants)
your periods stopping (in women who have not reached menopause) or not starting (in younger women and girls)
physical problems, such as feeling lightheaded or dizzy, hair loss or dry skin

name: arthritis
symptoms: inflammation in and around the joints
warm red skin over the affected joint

name: aspergillosis
symptoms: a cough – you may cough up blood or lumps of mucus
a high temperature of 38C or above

name: asthma
symptoms: a tight chest, which may feel like a band is tightening around it

name: bird-flu
symptoms: a very high temperature or feeling hot or shivery
bleeding from the nose and gums

name: bedbugs
symptoms: bites – often on areas exposed while sleeping, like the face, neck and arms
spots of blood on your bedding – from the bites or from squashing a bedbug
small brown spots on bedding or furniture (bedbug poo)

name: bells-palsy
symptoms: weakness or total paralysis on 1 side of your face that develops within 2 days
a drooping eyelid or corner of the mouth
eye irritation, such as dryness or more tears

name: bipolar-disorder
symptoms: depression – feeling very low and lethargic
mania – feeling very high and overactive

name: bird-flu
symptoms: a very high temperature or feeling hot or shivery
bleeding from the nose and gums

name: bleeding-from-the-bottom-rectal-bleeding
symptoms: red streaks on the outside of your poo
pink water in the toilet bowl
blood in your poo or bloody diarrhoea
very dark, smelly poo (this can be blood mixed in poo)

name: blepharitis
symptoms: a gritty feeling in the eyes
flakes or crusts around the roots of the eyelashes
eyelids sticking together in the morning when you wake up

name: body-dysmorphia
symptoms: worry a lot about a specific area of your body (particularly your face)
spend a lot of time comparing your looks with other people's
look at yourself in mirrors a lot or avoid mirrors altogether
go to a lot of effort to conceal flaws – for example, by spending a long time combing your hair, applying make-up or choosing clothes
pick at your skin to make it "smooth"

name: borderline-personality-disorder
symptoms: emotional instability – the psychological term for this is affective dysregulation
disturbed patterns of thinking or perception – cognitive distortions or perceptual distortions
intense but unstable relationships with others

name: malignant-brain-tumour
symptoms: headaches (often worse in the morning and when coughing or straining)
memory problems or changes in personality
weakness, vision problems or speech problems that get worse

name: brain-tumours
symptoms: persistently feeling sick (nausea), being sick (vomiting) and drowsiness
mental or behavioural changes, such as memory problems or changes in personality
progressive weakness or paralysis on one side of the body

name: broken-finger
symptoms: is pointing at an odd angle
is cut and you can see bone through it
is cut and there's bone poking out of it

name: broken-nose
symptoms: a crunching or crackling sound when you touch your nose
difficulty breathing out of your nose – it might feel blocked
your nose changing shape – for example, it's not as straight as before

name: broken-or-bruised-ribs
symptoms: strong pain in your chest area, particularly when you breathe in
swelling or tenderness around the affected ribs
feeling or hearing a crack if it's a broken rib

name: brucellosis
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above

name: teeth-grinding
symptoms: pain and stiffness in the jaw joint (temporomandibular joint) and surrounding muscles, which can lead to temporomandibular disorder (TMD)
disrupted sleep (for you or your partner)
worn-down teeth, which can lead to increased sensitivity and even tooth loss

name: bursitis
symptoms: painful – usually a dull, achy pain
more painful when you move it or press on it

name: sciatica
symptoms: painful – the pain may be stabbing, burning or shooting

name: carpal-tunnel-syndrome
symptoms: an ache or pain in your fingers, hand or arm
a weak thumb or difficulty gripping

name: catarrh
symptoms: constant need to clear your throat
feeling that your throat is blocked
blocked or stuffy nose that you cannot clear
feeling of mucus running down the back of your throat
reduced sense of smell and taste
crackling sensation in your ear and some temporary hearing loss

name: cellulitis
symptoms: red, hot and painful (it may also be swollen and blistered)

name: cervical-spondylosis
symptoms: neck and shoulder pain or stiffness – that comes and goes
headaches – often starting at the back of the neck

name: chest-infection
symptoms: a chesty cough – you may cough up green or yellow mucus

name: chickenpox
symptoms: aches and pains, and generally feeling unwell

name: chlamydia
symptoms: unusual discharge from the vagina, penis or bottom
in women, pain in the tummy, bleeding after sex and bleeding between periods
in men, pain and swelling in the testicles

name: chronic-fatigue-syndrome-cfs
symptoms: a sore throat or sore glands that are not swollen

name: cirrhosis
symptoms: get red patches on your palms and small, spider-like blood vessels on your skin (spider angiomas) above waist level
yellowing of the skin and whites of the eyes (jaundice)
swollen legs (oedema) or tummy (ascites) from a build-up of fluid

name: coeliac-disease
symptoms: diarrhoea, which may smell particularly unpleasant
tiredness (fatigue) as a result of not getting enough nutrients from food (malnutrition)
disorders that affect co-ordination, balance and speech (ataxia)

name: colic
symptoms: it's hard to soothe or settle your baby
they go red in the face
they bring their knees up to their tummy or arch their back
their tummy rumbles or they're very windy

name: common-cold
symptoms: pressure in your ears and face

name: confusion
symptoms: not be able to think or speak clearly or quickly
not know where they are (feel disorientated)
struggle to pay attention or remember things
see or hear things that aren't there (hallucinations)

name: conjunctivitis
symptoms: produce pus that sticks to lashes

name: constipation
symptoms: you have not had a poo at least 3 times during the last week
the poo is often large and dry, hard or lumpy
you are straining or in pain when you have a poo

name: costochondritis
symptoms: a particular posture, such as lying down
pressure on your chest, such as wearing a seatbelt or hugging someone

name: croup
symptoms: a barking cough that sounds like a seal (you can search online to hear examples)
a rasping sound when breathing in

name: cushings-syndrome
symptoms: increased fat on your chest and tummy, but slim arms and legs
a build-up of fat on the back of your neck and shoulders, known as a "buffalo hump"
weakness in your upper arms and thighs
a low libido and fertility problems

name: cystitis
symptoms: pain, burning or stinging when you pee
needing to pee more often and urgently than normal
urine that's dark, cloudy or strong smelling
pain low down in your tummy
feeling generally unwell, achy, sick and tired
needing to pee urgently or more often
a high temperature (fever) of 38C or above

name: cytomegalovirus-cmv
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or more

name: dehydration
symptoms: a dry mouth, lips and eyes
peeing little, and fewer than 4 times a day
been in the sun too long (heatstroke)
a high temperature of 38C or more
been taking medicines that make you pee more (diuretics)

name: confusion
symptoms: not be able to think or speak clearly or quickly
not know where they are (feel disorientated)
struggle to pay attention or remember things
see or hear things that aren't there (hallucinations)

name: vascular-dementia
symptoms: changes to your mood, personality or behaviour
symptoms of Alzheimer's disease, such as problems with memory and language (many people with vascular dementia also have Alzheimer's disease)

name: dental-abscess
symptoms: an intense throbbing pain in the affected tooth or gum that may come on suddenly and gets gradually worse
pain that spreads to your ear, jaw and neck on the same side as the affected tooth or gum
pain that's worse when lying down, which may disturb your sleep
redness and swelling in your face
a tender, discoloured or loose tooth
sensitivity to hot or cold food and drink
bad breath or an unpleasant taste in your mouth

name: diphtheria
symptoms: a thick grey-white coating at the back of your throat
a high temperature (fever) of 38C or above
pus-filled blisters on your legs, feet and hands
large ulcers surrounded by red, sore-looking skin

name: dissociative-disorders
symptoms: feeling disconnected from yourself and the world around you
forgetting about certain time periods, events and personal information
feeling uncertain about who you are
feeling little or no physical pain

name: dizziness
symptoms: like you're spinning or things around you are spinning (vertigo)

name: dystonia
symptoms: parts of your body twisting into unusual positions – such as your neck being twisted to the side or your feet turning inwards
activities like writing, typing or playing an instrument

name: ear-infections
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above
discharge running out of the ear
a feeling of pressure or fullness inside the ear
itching and irritation in and around the ear
scaly skin in and around the ear

name: earache
symptoms: do not react to some sounds
have a temperature of 38C or above

name: perforated-eardrum
symptoms: sudden hearing loss – you may find it difficult to hear anything or your hearing may just be slightly muffled
earache or pain in your ear
ringing or buzzing in your ear (tinnitus)

name: earwax-build-up
symptoms: sounds such as high-pitched tones coming from inside the ear (tinnitus)

name: eating-disorders
symptoms: spending a lot of time worrying about your weight and body shape
avoiding socialising when you think food will be involved
deliberately making yourself sick or taking laxatives after you eat
having very strict habits or routines around food
your weight being very high or very low for someone of your age and height
not getting your period for women and girls

name: ehlers-danlos-syndromes
symptoms: an increased range of joint movement (joint hypermobility)
fragile skin that breaks or bruises easily

name: encephalitis
symptoms: weakness or loss of movement in some parts of the body

name: endometriosis
symptoms: pain in your lower tummy or back (pelvic pain) – usually worse during your period
period pain that stops you doing your normal activities
pain when peeing or pooing during your period
feeling sick, constipation, diarrhoea, or blood in your pee during your period

name: epididymitis
symptoms: sudden or gradual pain in 1 or both of your testicles (balls)
the bag of skin containing your testicles (scrotum) feeling tender, warm and swollen
a build-up of fluid around your testicle (a hydrocele) that feels like a lump or swelling

name: epilepsy
symptoms: uncontrollable jerking and shaking, called a "fit"
losing awareness and staring blankly into space
strange sensations, such as a "rising" feeling in the tummy, unusual smells or tastes, and a tingling feeling in your arms or legs

name: erythema-nodosum
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or more

name: erythromelalgia
symptoms: swelling of the affected body part
sweating in the affected area more or less than you usually would
purple discolouration when there's no flare-up

name: fibromyalgia
symptoms: problems with mental processes (known as "fibro-fog"), such as problems with memory and concentration
irritable bowel syndrome (IBS), a digestive condition that causes stomach pain and bloating

name: flu
symptoms: a sudden fever – a temperature of 38C or above

name: frozen-shoulder
symptoms: you have shoulder pain and stiffness that does not go away – pain can be worse at night when sleeping
the pain is so bad it makes it hard to move your arm and shoulder

name: gallstones
symptoms: yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)

name: heartburn-and-acid-reflux
symptoms: heartburn – a burning sensation in the middle of your chest
an unpleasant sour taste in your mouth, caused by stomach acid
a cough or hiccups that keep coming back

name: genital-herpes
symptoms: small blisters that burst to leave red, open sores around your genitals, anus, thighs or bottom
tingling, burning or itching around your genitals
in women, vaginal discharge that's not usual for you

name: genital-warts
symptoms: 1 or more painless growths or lumps around your vagina, penis or anus
itching or bleeding from your genitals or anus
a change to your normal flow of pee (for example, it's begun to flow sideways) that does not go away
a sexual partner who has genital warts, even if you do not have symptoms

name: giardiasis
symptoms: smelly burps – they may smell like eggs

name: gilberts-syndrome
symptoms: irritable bowel syndrome (IBS) – a common digestive disorder that causes stomach cramps, bloating, diarrhoea and constipation
problems concentrating and thinking clearly (brain fog)
a general sense of feeling unwell

name: glandular-fever
symptoms: a very high temperature or you feel hot and shivery
swelling either side of your neck – swollen glands
tonsillitis that is not getting better

name: glue-ear
symptoms: hearing sounds like ringing or buzzing (tinnitus)

name: goitre
symptoms: a tight feeling in your throat
changes to your voice, such as hoarseness
difficulty breathing – there may be a high-pitched sound when you breathe

name: gout
symptoms: sudden severe pain in any joint – usually the big toe, or fingers, wrists, elbows or knees
red, hot, swollen skin over the affected joint
the pain is getting much worse and you have a very high temperature (you feel hot and shivery)

name: hay-fever
symptoms: itchy throat, mouth, nose and ears
pain around your temples and forehead
have a tight feeling in your chest

name: head-lice-and-nits
symptoms: like something is moving in your hair

name: health-anxiety
symptoms: frequently check your body for signs of illness, such as lumps, tingling or pain
are always asking people for reassurance that you're not ill
worry that your doctor or medical tests may have missed something
obsessively look at health information on the internet or in the media
avoid anything to do with serious illness, such as medical TV programmes
act as if you were ill (for example, avoiding physical activities)

name: heart-attack
symptoms: chest pain – the chest can feel like it's being pressed or squeezed by a heavy object, and pain can radiate from the chest to the jaw, neck, arms and back
feeling weak or lightheaded, or both

name: heart-failure
symptoms: breathlessness after activity or at rest
feeling tired most of the time and finding exercise exhausting

name: heartburn-and-acid-reflux
symptoms: heartburn – a burning sensation in the middle of your chest
an unpleasant sour taste in your mouth, caused by stomach acid
a cough or hiccups that keep coming back

name: heat-exhaustion-heatstroke
symptoms: loss of appetite and feeling sick
excessive sweating and pale, clammy skin
cramps in the arms, legs and stomach

name: heavy-periods
symptoms: are having to change your sanitary products every hour or 2
are passing blood clots larger than 2.5cm (about the size of a 10p coin)
are bleeding through to your clothes or bedding
need to use 2 types of sanitary product together (for example, tampons and pads)

name: hepatitis-b
symptoms: flu-like symptoms, including tiredness, a fever, and general aches and pains
yellowing of the skin and eyes (jaundice)

name: hepatitis-c
symptoms: flu-like symptoms, such as muscle aches and a high temperature (fever)

name: hiatus-hernia
symptoms: have a painful burning feeling in your chest, often after eating (heartburn)
bring up small amounts of food or bitter-tasting fluids (acid reflux)
have difficulty or pain when swallowing

name: genital-herpes
symptoms: small blisters that burst to leave red, open sores around your genitals, anus, thighs or bottom
tingling, burning or itching around your genitals
in women, vaginal discharge that's not usual for you

name: hiatus-hernia
symptoms: have a painful burning feeling in your chest, often after eating (heartburn)
bring up small amounts of food or bitter-tasting fluids (acid reflux)
have difficulty or pain when swallowing

name: hidradenitis-suppurativa
symptoms: on the bottom and around the anus

name: fever-in-children
symptoms: feel hotter than usual to the touch on their forehead, back or tummy

name: hiv-and-aids
symptoms: men who have sex with men
people who share needles, syringes or other injecting equipment

name: huntingtons-disease
symptoms: involuntary jerking or fidgety movements of the limbs and body

name: high-blood-sugar-hyperglycaemia
symptoms: increased thirst and a dry mouth
recurrent infections, such as thrush, bladder infections (cystitis) and skin infections

name: excessive-daytime-sleepiness-hypersomnia
symptoms: regularly nap during the day and not feel refreshed
fall asleep during the day, often while eating or talking
still sleep for long hours at night

name: health-anxiety
symptoms: frequently check your body for signs of illness, such as lumps, tingling or pain
are always asking people for reassurance that you're not ill
worry that your doctor or medical tests may have missed something
obsessively look at health information on the internet or in the media
avoid anything to do with serious illness, such as medical TV programmes
act as if you were ill (for example, avoiding physical activities)

name: low-blood-sugar-hypoglycaemia
symptoms: becoming easily irritated, tearful, stroppy or moody
unusual behaviour, slurred speech or clumsiness (like being drunk)

name: hypothermia
symptoms: pale, cold and dry skin – their skin and lips may be blue
cold to touch and their skin may be red
unusually quiet and sleepy and may refuse to feed

name: impetigo
symptoms: look a bit like cornflakes stuck to your skin
spread to other parts of your body

name: indigestion
symptoms: heartburn – a painful burning feeling in the chest, often after eating
bringing up food or bitter-tasting fluids into your mouth

name: flu
symptoms: a sudden fever – a temperature of 38C or above

name: insomnia
symptoms: find it hard to go to sleep
wake up several times during the night
wake up early and cannot go back to sleep
still feel tired after waking up
find it hard to nap during the day even though you're tired
feel tired and irritable during the day
find it difficult to concentrate during the day because you're tired

name: interstitial-cystitis
symptoms: intense pelvic pain (felt below your bellybutton)
needing to pee more often than normal
waking up several times during the night to go to the toilet

name: temporomandibular-disorder-tmd
symptoms: pain around your jaw, ear and temple
clicking, popping or grinding noises when you move your jaw
your jaw locking when you open your mouth

name: jet-lag
symptoms: difficulty sleeping at bedtime and waking up in the morning
difficulty staying awake during the day

name: joint-hypermobility-syndrome
symptoms: often get pain or stiffness in your joints or muscles
have digestive problems like diarrhoea or constipation

name: kidney-infection
symptoms: needing to pee suddenly or more often than usual
pain or a burning sensation when peeing

name: laryngitis
symptoms: an irritating cough that does not go away
always needing to clear your throat
have a high temperature of 38C or above
be off their food or drink
have difficulty breathing (but this is rare)

name: leg-cramps
symptoms: calf muscle, below the knee at the back of the leg
muscles in the feet or the thighs (less often)

name: leukoplakia
symptoms: may be slightly red within the patch
cannot be rubbed or scraped away (patches that can be removed could be oral thrush)

name: lichen-planus
symptoms: clusters of shiny, raised, purple-red blotches on your arms, legs or body (you may see fine white lines on the blotches)
white patches on your gums, tongue or the insides of your cheeks
burning and stinging in your mouth, especially when you eat or drink
bald patches appearing on your scalp
sore red patches on your vulva
rough, thinning nails with grooves on
ring-shaped purple or white patches on your penis

name: lichen-sclerosus
symptoms: easily damaged – they may bleed or hurt if rubbed or scratched
area around the opening of the vagina (vulva) and anus – in girls and women
foreskin and end of the penis – in boys and men

name: lipoma
symptoms: can be anything from the size of a pea to a few centimetres across
may move slightly under your skin if you press them

name: listeriosis
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above

name: alcohol-related-liver-disease-arld
symptoms: yellowing of the eyes and skin (jaundice)
swelling in the ankles and tummy
vomiting blood or passing blood in your stools

name: low-blood-sugar-hypoglycaemia
symptoms: becoming easily irritated, tearful, stroppy or moody
unusual behaviour, slurred speech or clumsiness (like being drunk)

name: lupus
symptoms: extreme tiredness that will not go away no matter how much you rest
skin rashes – often over the nose and cheeks
sensitivity to light (causing rashes on uncovered skin)
poor circulation in fingers and toes (Raynaud's)

name: lyme-disease
symptoms: a high temperature, or feeling hot and shivery

name: malignant-brain-tumour
symptoms: headaches (often worse in the morning and when coughing or straining)
memory problems or changes in personality
weakness, vision problems or speech problems that get worse

name: maple-syrup-urine-disease
symptoms: poor feeding or loss of appetite

name: measles
symptoms: cold-like symptoms, such as a runny nose, sneezing and a cough
sore, red eyes that may be sensitive to light
a high temperature (fever), which may reach around 40C
small greyish-white spots on the inside of the cheeks

name: meningitis
symptoms: a high temperature (fever) of 38C or above
a rash that does not fade when a glass is rolled over it (but a rash will not always develop)

name: menopause
symptoms: vaginal dryness and discomfort during sex

name: motor-neurone-disease
symptoms: weakness in your ankle or leg – you might trip, or find it harder to climb stairs
slurred speech, which may develop into difficulty swallowing some foods
a weak grip – you might drop things, or find it hard to open jars or do up buttons
weight loss – your arms or leg muscles may have become thinner over time
difficulty stopping yourself from crying or laughing in inappropriate situations

name: oral-thrush-mouth-thrush
symptoms: cracks at the corners of the mouth
an unpleasant taste in the mouth
pain inside the mouth (for example, a sore tongue or sore gums)
they do not want to feed

name: mouth-ulcers
symptoms: hand, foot and mouth disease, which also causes a rash on the hands and feet
oral lichen planus, which causes a white, lacy pattern inside the cheeks

name: mrsa
symptoms: redness, but this may be less visible on darker skin

name: multiple-myeloma
symptoms: a persistent dull ache or areas of tenderness in your bones
tiredness, weakness and shortness of breath – caused by anaemia
less commonly, bruising and unusual bleeding – such as frequent nosebleeds, bleeding gums and heavy periods

name: multiple-sclerosis
symptoms: vision problems, such as blurred vision
numbness or tingling in different parts of the body
problems with thinking, learning and planning

name: chronic-fatigue-syndrome-cfs
symptoms: a sore throat or sore glands that are not swollen

name: multiple-myeloma
symptoms: a persistent dull ache or areas of tenderness in your bones
tiredness, weakness and shortness of breath – caused by anaemia
less commonly, bruising and unusual bleeding – such as frequent nosebleeds, bleeding gums and heavy periods

name: menieres-disease
symptoms: feel dizziness with a spinning sensation (vertigo)
hear ringing, roaring or buzzing inside your ear
have a sudden drop in hearing

name: nasal-and-sinus-cancer
symptoms: a persistent blocked nose, which usually only affects 1 side
mucus draining into the back of your nose and throat
pain or numbness in the face, particularly in the upper cheek
partial loss of vision or double vision
a bulging or persistently watering eye
a persistent lump or growth on your face, nose or roof of your mouth

name: nasal-polyps
symptoms: reduced sense of smell or taste

name: neurofibromatosis-type-1
symptoms: pale, coffee-coloured patches (café au lait spots)
soft, non-cancerous tumours on or under the skin (neurofibromas)
clusters of freckles in unusual places – such as the armpits, groin and under the breast
problems with the bones, eyes and nervous system

name: neurofibromatosis-type-2
symptoms: hearing loss that gradually gets worse over time
hearing ringing or buzzing in the ears (tinnitus)
balance problems – particularly when moving in the dark or walking on uneven ground

name: non-alcoholic-fatty-liver-disease
symptoms: a dull or aching pain in the top right of the tummy (over the lower right side of the ribs)

name: nasal-and-sinus-cancer
symptoms: a persistent blocked nose, which usually only affects 1 side
mucus draining into the back of your nose and throat
pain or numbness in the face, particularly in the upper cheek
partial loss of vision or double vision
a bulging or persistently watering eye
a persistent lump or growth on your face, nose or roof of your mouth

name: obesity
symptoms: 18.5 to 24.9 means you're a healthy weight
40 or above means you're severely obese

name: obsessive-compulsive-disorder-ocd
symptoms: An obsession is an unwanted and unpleasant thought, image or urge that repeatedly enters your mind, causing feelings of anxiety, disgust or unease.
A compulsion is a repetitive behaviour or mental act that you feel you need to do to temporarily relieve the unpleasant feelings brought on by the obsessive thought.

name: oral-thrush-mouth-thrush
symptoms: cracks at the corners of the mouth
an unpleasant taste in the mouth
pain inside the mouth (for example, a sore tongue or sore gums)
they do not want to feed

name: ovarian-cancer
symptoms: discomfort in your tummy or pelvic area
needing to pee more often than usual

name: ovarian-cyst
symptoms: pelvic pain – this can range from a dull, heavy sensation to a sudden, severe and sharp pain
heavy periods, irregular periods or lighter periods than normal
feeling very full after only eating a little
difficulty getting pregnant – although fertility is usually unaffected by ovarian cysts

name: acute-pancreatitis
symptoms: suddenly getting severe pain in the centre of your tummy (abdomen)
a high temperature of 38C or more (fever)

name: panic-disorder
symptoms: a need to go to the toilet
a feeling of dread or a fear of dying
feeling like you're not connected to your body

name: paralysis
symptoms: both arms and legs (tetraplegia or quadriplegia)
stiff (spastic paralysis), with occasional muscle spasms

name: parkinsons-disease
symptoms: involuntary shaking of particular parts of the body (tremor)
balance problems (this may increase the chances of a fall)

name: pelvic-inflammatory-disease-pid
symptoms: pain around the pelvis or lower tummy
discomfort or pain during sex that's felt deep inside the pelvis
bleeding between periods and after sex
unusual vaginal discharge, especially if it's yellow or green

name: pelvic-organ-prolapse
symptoms: a feeling of heaviness around your lower tummy and genitals
a dragging discomfort inside your vagina
feeling like there's something coming down into your vagina – it may feel like sitting on a small ball
feeling or seeing a bulge or lump in or coming out of your vagina

problems peeing – such as feeling like your bladder is not emptying fully, needing to go to the toilet more often, or leaking a small amount of pee when you cough, sneeze or exercise (stress incontinence)

name: perforated-eardrum
symptoms: sudden hearing loss – you may find it difficult to hear anything or your hearing may just be slightly muffled
earache or pain in your ear
ringing or buzzing in your ear (tinnitus)

name: pericarditis
symptoms: gets worse when you take a deep breath in or lie down

name: heavy-periods
symptoms: are having to change your sanitary products every hour or 2
are passing blood clots larger than 2.5cm (about the size of a 10p coin)
are bleeding through to your clothes or bedding
need to use 2 types of sanitary product together (for example, tampons and pads)

name: peripheral-neuropathy
symptoms: numbness and tingling in the feet or hands
burning, stabbing or shooting pain in affected areas
muscle weakness, especially in the feet

name: phlebitis
symptoms: painful hard lumps underneath the skin

name: piles-haemorrhoids
symptoms: bright red blood after you poo
feeling like you still need to poo after going to the toilet
slimy mucus in your underwear or on toilet paper after wiping your bottom

name: piles-haemorrhoids
symptoms: bright red blood after you poo
feeling like you still need to poo after going to the toilet
slimy mucus in your underwear or on toilet paper after wiping your bottom

name: plantar-fasciitis
symptoms: the pain is much worse when you start walking after sleeping or resting
the pain feels better during exercise, but returns after resting
it's difficult to raise your toes off the floor

name: pre-menstrual-syndrome
symptoms: changes in appetite and sex drive

name: pneumonia
symptoms: a cough – which may be dry, or produce thick yellow, green, brown or blood-stained mucus (phlegm)
difficulty breathing – your breathing may be rapid and shallow, and you may feel breathless, even when resting
chest pain – which gets worse when breathing or coughing
feeling confused and disorientated, particularly in elderly people

name: polycystic-ovary-syndrome-pcos
symptoms: irregular periods or no periods at all
difficulty getting pregnant as a result of irregular ovulation or failure to ovulate
excessive hair growth (hirsutism) – usually on the face, chest, back or buttocks
thinning hair and hair loss from the head

name: polymorphic-light-eruption
symptoms: most people get crops of 2mm to 5mm pink or red raised spots
some people get blisters that turn into larger, dry, red patches – it looks a bit like eczema
less commonly, the skin patches look like targets or bull's eyes (it looks a bit like erythema multiforme)

name: post-natal-depression
symptoms: a persistent feeling of sadness and low mood
lack of enjoyment and loss of interest in the wider world
lack of energy and feeling tired all the time
trouble sleeping at night and feeling sleepy during the day
withdrawing from contact with other people
frightening thoughts – for example, about hurting your baby

name: pre-eclampsia
symptoms: swelling of the feet, ankles, face and hands caused by fluid retention (oedema)

name: pelvic-organ-prolapse
symptoms: a feeling of heaviness around your lower tummy and genitals
a dragging discomfort inside your vagina
feeling like there's something coming down into your vagina – it may feel like sitting on a small ball
feeling or seeing a bulge or lump in or coming out of your vagina

problems peeing – such as feeling like your bladder is not emptying fully, needing to go to the toilet more often, or leaking a small amount of pee when you cough, sneeze or exercise (stress incontinence)

name: prostate-cancer
symptoms: a feeling that your bladder has not fully emptied

name: psychosis
symptoms: hallucinations – where a person hears, sees and, in some cases, feels, smells or tastes things that do not exist outside their mind but can feel very real to the person affected by them; a common hallucination is hearing voices
delusions – where a person has strong beliefs that are not shared by others; a common delusion is someone believing there's a conspiracy to harm them

name: pulmonary-embolism
symptoms: you feel pain in your chest or upper back

name: tonsillitis
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above
swollen, painful glands in your neck (feels like a lump on the side of your neck)
white pus-filled spots on your tonsils at the back of your throat

name: bleeding-from-the-bottom-rectal-bleeding
symptoms: red streaks on the outside of your poo
pink water in the toilet bowl
blood in your poo or bloody diarrhoea
very dark, smelly poo (this can be blood mixed in poo)

name: reflux-in-babies
symptoms: bringing up milk or being sick during or shortly after feeding
swallowing or gulping after burping or feeding
not gaining weight as they're not keeping enough food down

name: rheumatic-fever
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above (fever)
redness, pain and swelling of your joints (arthritis) – usually ankles, knees, wrists or elbows
pain in your chest, breathlessness and a fast heart rate
jerky, uncontrollable movements in your hands, feet and face
pale-red patches on your arms and tummy

name: rubella
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above

name: salivary-gland-stones
symptoms: dull pain in your mouth that comes and goes
swelling in your mouth that flares up from time to time

name: schizophrenia
symptoms: hallucinations – hearing or seeing things that do not exist outside of the mind
delusions – unusual beliefs not based on reality
muddled thoughts based on hallucinations or delusions
not caring about your personal hygiene
wanting to avoid people, including friends

name: sciatica
symptoms: painful – the pain may be stabbing, burning or shooting

name: sexually-transmitted-infections-stis
symptoms: unusual discharge from the vagina, penis or anus
lumps or skin growths around the genitals or anus
blisters and sores around the genitals or anus

name: shingles
symptoms: a tingling or painful feeling in an area of skin
a headache or feeling generally unwell

name: shoulder-impingement-syndrome
symptoms: pain in the top and outer side of your shoulder
pain that's worse when you lift your arm, especially when you lift it above your head
pain or aching at night, which can affect your sleep

name: nasal-and-sinus-cancer
symptoms: a persistent blocked nose, which usually only affects 1 side
mucus draining into the back of your nose and throat
pain or numbness in the face, particularly in the upper cheek
partial loss of vision or double vision
a bulging or persistently watering eye
a persistent lump or growth on your face, nose or roof of your mouth

name: sinusitis-sinus-infection
symptoms: pain, swelling and tenderness around your cheeks, eyes or forehead
green or yellow mucus from your nose

name: sinusitis-sinus-infection
symptoms: pain, swelling and tenderness around your cheeks, eyes or forehead
green or yellow mucus from your nose

name: sjogrens-syndrome
symptoms: swelling between the jaw and ears (swollen salivary glands)
rashes (especially after being in the sun)

name: skin-picking-disorder
symptoms: cause cuts, bleeding or bruising by picking your skin
pick moles, freckles, spots or scars to try to "smooth" or "perfect" them
do not always realise you're picking your skin or do it when you're asleep
pick your skin when you feel anxious or stressed

name: skin-tags
symptoms: smooth and soft (warts tend to be rougher with an irregular surface)
knobbly and hang off the skin (warts are usually slightly raised or flat)
not contagious (warts spread very easily, so a sudden outbreak or cluster of growths is more likely to be warts)

name: slapped-cheek-syndrome
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or more
a runny nose and sore throat

name: sleep-apnoea
symptoms: making gasping, snorting or choking noises
have a headache when you wake up

name: slipped-disc
symptoms: numbness or tingling in your shoulders, back, arms, hands, legs or feet
problems bending or straightening your back
pain in the buttocks, hips or legs if the disc is pressing on the sciatic nerve (sciatica)

name: social-anxiety
symptoms: worry about everyday activities, such as meeting strangers, starting conversations, speaking on the phone, working or shopping
avoid or worry a lot about social activities, such as group conversations, eating with company and parties
always worry about doing something you think is embarrassing, such as blushing, sweating or appearing incompetent
find it difficult to do things when others are watching – you may feel like you're being watched and judged all the time
fear being criticised, avoid eye contact or have low self-esteem
often have symptoms like feeling sick, sweating, trembling or a pounding heartbeat (palpitations)
have panic attacks, where you have an overwhelming sense of fear and anxiety, usually only for a few minutes

name: sprains-and-strains
symptoms: you have pain, tenderness or weakness – often around your ankle, foot, wrist, thumb, knee, leg or back
the injured area is swollen or bruised
you cannot put weight on the injury or use it normally
you have muscle spasms or cramping – where your muscles painfully tighten on their own

name: stomach-cancer
symptoms: symptoms of indigestion, such as burping a lot
feeling full very quickly when eating
loss of appetite or losing weight without trying to
a lump at the top of your tummy
pain at the top of your tummy
feeling tired or having no energy

name: stroke
symptoms: Face – the face may have dropped on 1 side, the person may not be able to smile, or their mouth or eye may have dropped.
Arms – the person with suspected stroke may not be able to lift both arms and keep them there because of weakness or numbness in 1 arm.
Speech – their speech may be slurred or garbled, or the person may not be able to talk at all despite appearing to be awake; they may also have problems understanding what you're saying to them.
Time – it's time to dial 999 immediately if you see any of these signs or symptoms.

name: stye
symptoms: there's no lump – if your eye or eyelid is swollen, red and watery it's more likely to be conjunctivitis or blepharitis
the lump is hard but not very painful – it's more likely to be a chalazion

name: confusion
symptoms: not be able to think or speak clearly or quickly
not know where they are (feel disorientated)
struggle to pay attention or remember things
see or hear things that aren't there (hallucinations)

name: phlebitis
symptoms: painful hard lumps underneath the skin

name: supraventricular-tachycardia-svt
symptoms: usually lasts for a few minutes, but can sometimes last for several hours
can happen several times a day or once a year – it varies
can be triggered by tiredness, caffeine, alcohol or drugs – but often there's no obvious trigger
can happen at any age, but often starts for the first time in children and young adults – many people have their first symptoms between 25 and 40

name: swollen-glands
symptoms: on each side of the neck

name: syphilis
symptoms: small, painless sores or ulcers that typically appear on the penis, vagina, or around the anus, but can occur in other places such as the mouth
a blotchy red rash that often affects the palms of the hands or soles of the feet
small skin growths (similar to genital warts) that may develop on the vulva in women or around the bottom (anus) in both men and women
tiredness, headaches, joint pains, a high temperature (fever) and swollen glands in your neck, groin or armpits

name: tay-sachs-disease
symptoms: being overly startled by noises and movement
being very slow to reach milestones like learning to crawl, and losing skills they have already learnt
floppiness and weakness, which keeps getting worse until they're unable to move (paralysis)

name: teeth-grinding
symptoms: pain and stiffness in the jaw joint (temporomandibular joint) and surrounding muscles, which can lead to temporomandibular disorder (TMD)
disrupted sleep (for you or your partner)
worn-down teeth, which can lead to increased sensitivity and even tooth loss

name: temporal-arteritis
symptoms: pain and tenderness over the temples
jaw pain while eating or talking
vision problems, such as double vision or a loss of vision in 1 or both eyes

name: temporomandibular-disorder-tmd
symptoms: pain around your jaw, ear and temple
clicking, popping or grinding noises when you move your jaw
your jaw locking when you open your mouth

name: tendonitis
symptoms: pain in a tendon that gets worse when you move
feeling a grating or crackling sensation when you move the tendon
swelling, sometimes with heat or redness

name: thrush-in-men-and-women
symptoms: white vaginal discharge (like cottage cheese), which does not usually smell
itching and irritation around the vagina
soreness and stinging during sex or when you pee
irritation, burning and redness around the head of the penis and under the foreskin

name: transient-ischaemic-attack-tia
symptoms: Face – the face may have dropped on 1 side, the person may not be able to smile, or their mouth or eye may have dropped.
Arms – the person may not be able to lift both arms and keep them raised because of weakness or numbness in 1 arm.
Speech – their speech may be slurred or garbled, or the person may not be able to talk at all, despite appearing to be awake; they may also have problems understanding what you're saying to them.
Time – it's time to call 999 immediately if you see any of these signs or symptoms.

name: tongue-tie
symptoms: have difficulty attaching to the breast or staying attached for a full feed
feed for a long time, have a short break, then feed again
be unsettled and seem to be hungry all the time
not gain weight as quickly as they should
make a "clicking" sound as they feed – this can also be a sign you need support with the positioning and attachment of your baby at the breast
mastitis (inflammation of the breast), which may keep coming back

name: tonsillitis
symptoms: a high temperature of 38C or above
swollen, painful glands in your neck (feels like a lump on the side of your neck)
white pus-filled spots on your tonsils at the back of your throat

name: transient-ischaemic-attack-tia
symptoms: Face – the face may have dropped on 1 side, the person may not be able to smile, or their mouth or eye may have dropped.
Arms – the person may not be able to lift both arms and keep them raised because of weakness or numbness in 1 arm.
Speech – their speech may be slurred or garbled, or the person may not be able to talk at all, despite appearing to be awake; they may also have problems understanding what you're saying to them.
Time – it's time to call 999 immediately if you see any of these signs or symptoms.

name: trichomoniasis
symptoms: abnormal vaginal discharge that may be thick, thin or frothy and yellow-green in colour
producing more discharge than normal, which may also have an unpleasant fishy smell
soreness, swelling and itching around the vagina – sometimes the inner thighs also become itchy
pain or discomfort when passing urine or having sex
pain when peeing or during ejaculation
needing to pee more frequently than usual
thin, white discharge from the penis
soreness, swelling and redness around the head of the penis or foreskin

name: trimethylaminuria
symptoms: certain foods – such as fish, eggs and beans

name: typhus
symptoms: a dark spotty rash on your chest that may spread to the rest of your body (apart from your face, palms of your hands and soles of your feet)

name: ulcerative-colitis
symptoms: recurring diarrhoea, which may contain blood, mucus or pus
needing to empty your bowels frequently

name: urinary-tract-infections-utis
symptoms: needing to pee suddenly or more often than usual
pain or a burning sensation when peeing
in older people, changes in behaviour such as severe confusion or agitation
appear generally unwell – babies may be irritable, not feed properly and have a high temperature of 37.5C or above
wet the bed or wet themselves
deliberately hold in their pee because it stings

name: vaginal-cancer
symptoms: bleeding after sex or pain during sex
a lump or itch in your vagina that won't go away
pain when peeing, or needing to pee a lot

name: vaginal-discharge
symptoms: doesn't have a strong or unpleasant smell

name: vaginal-dryness
symptoms: feel sore or itchy in and around your vagina
feel pain or discomfort during sex
need to pee more often than usual

name: vulvodynia
symptoms: triggered by touch, such as during sex or when inserting a tampon
limited to part of the vulva, such as the opening of the vagina
more widespread – sometimes it can spread over the whole genital area and the anus

name: vaginismus
symptoms: you find it hard inserting a tampon into your vagina
you struggle with vaginal penetration during sex
you feel burning or stinging pain during sex

name: vaginitis
symptoms: vaginal discharge that's a different colour, smell or thickness to usual
pain when peeing or having sex
sore, swollen or cracked skin around your vagina

name: vascular-dementia
symptoms: changes to your mood, personality or behaviour
symptoms of Alzheimer's disease, such as problems with memory and language (many people with vascular dementia also have Alzheimer's disease)

name: vitamin-b12-or-folate-deficiency-anaemia
symptoms: psychological problems, which may include depression and confusion
problems with memory, understanding and judgement

name: vulval-cancer
symptoms: a persistent itch in the vulva
pain, soreness or tenderness in the vulva
raised and thickened patches of skin that can be red, white or dark
a lump or wart-like growth on the vulva
bleeding from the vulva or blood-stained vaginal discharge between periods
an open sore in the vulva
a burning pain when passing urine
a mole on the vulva that changes shape or colour

name: vulvodynia
symptoms: triggered by touch, such as during sex or when inserting a tampon
limited to part of the vulva, such as the opening of the vagina
more widespread – sometimes it can spread over the whole genital area and the anus

name: zika
symptoms: joint pain (with possible swelling, mainly in the smaller joints of the hands and feet)
